issue.title: scala3: publishing scala 3 artifacts

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
There are 2 ways Akka can support Scala 3: by making sure our 2.13.x artifacts work from Scala 3, and by publishing our own Scala 3 artifacts.

This is an 'umbrella issue' to track progress and issues with the second, more long-term goal: publishing our own Scala 3 artifacts. The other, perhaps more short-term goal is tracked in #30242.

A good first step is compiling modules with Scala 3. You can already compile some modules with `sbt -Dakka.build.scalaVersion=3.0`, and a Travis test makes sure that those remain compilable on Scala 3.

* [x] akka-actor
* [x] Test/akka-actor-tests
* [x] akka-actor-testkit-typed #30395 
* [x] Test/akka-actor-testkit-typed #30423
* [x] akka-actor-typed #30258
* [x] Test/akka-actor-typed-tests  #30423
* [x] akka-bench-jmh #30682 
* [x] akka-cluster/compile #30417 
* [x] akka-cluster/Test/compile #30417 
* [x] akka-cluster/test #30890
* [x] akka-cluster-metrics/Test/compile #30690
* [x] akka-cluster-metrics/test #30891
* [x] akka-cluster-sharding #30712
* [x] akka-cluster-sharding/test #30904
* [x] akka-cluster-sharding-typed #30738
* [x] akka-cluster-sharding-typed/test #30892
* [x] akka-cluster-tools #30683
* [x] akka-cluster-typed #30703 
* [x] akka-coordination #30386
* [x] Test/akka-coordination #30409 
* [x] akka-discovery #30396
* [x] Test/akka-discovery #30410
* [x] akka-distributed-data #30666
* [x] akka-distributed-data/test #30666
* [ ] akka-docs depends on https://github.com/spray/spray-json/pull/342
* [x] akka-persistence #30406
* [x] akka-persistence-tck #30911
* [x] akka-persistence-testkit #30772
* [x] akka-persistence-typed #30772
* [x] akka-persistence-typed-tests #30911
* [x] akka-persistence-query #30663
* [x] akka-persistence-shared #30663
* [x] akka-pki #30385
* [x] akka-protobuf #30385
* [x] akka-protobuf-v3 #30385
* [x] akka-remote #30361
* [x] akka-remote/test #30415
* [x] akka-remote-tests/test #30415
* [x] akka-slf4j #30385
* [x] akka-serialization-jackson #30408
* [x] akka-serialization-jackson/Test/compile #30408
* [x] akka-serialization-jackson/test #30670 
* [x] akka-stream #30324
* [x] akka-stream-testkit #30407 
* [x] akka-stream-typed #30910 
* [x] test:akka-stream-tests-tck #30360
* [x] test:akka-stream-tests #30451
* [x] akka-testkit #30407 
* [x] akka-actor/doc (depends on https://github.com/lampepfl/dotty/issues/13061)

Also:
* [x] #30245

One challenge is jackson-module-scala will have experimental scala3 support in v2.13.0 (https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-module-scala#scala-3), but we might not want to update to that just yet (see also e.g. #30343). Since we don't use jackson-module-scala directly, but add it as a transitive dependency for the convenience of downstream projects, as a first step we might just remove it from the dependencies for the Scala 3 build.

issue.title: failed: StackOverflowError in multi-node tests with Scala 2.13.7

labels.name: failed
labels.description: Tickets that indicate a CI failure, likely a flakey test

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/30870 introduced some regression. I can reproduce with latest on `main` with:
```
sbt:akka-cluster> multi-jvm:testOnly akka.cluster.StreamRef
```

and it works after revert of 523b5b7f43

body: This might be fixed by https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/30886, I haven't tried.

issue.title: Scala 3: enable akka-cluster tests

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
closes #30689

Looks like it has been fixed with https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/30886

body:
> This might be fixed by #30886, I haven't tried.

I think it looks like that: `sbt -Dakka.build.scalaVersion=3.x -Dakka.test.multi-node=true akka-cluster/test` fails for me since I don't have multi-node testing set up, but I think earlier it failed before it even got that far. Let's see if the nightly builds agree after merging #30890 :)

It failed as multi-jvm, so you don't have to set `-Dakka.test.multi-node=true`.
`akka-cluster/test` or `akka-cluster/multi-jvm:test` should be enough

agreed, that we can look at the nightlies
